chargeHist.descr: Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J Jowett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.02(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, or by any other means with Ricky Eddy or Angelica Reichenbach.  

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Defendant to be subject to random drug screens by his agent.  

Defendant is to consistently follow up with his mental heath aftercare program.  Agent to ensure that the defendant is up to date with the medications that he requires.  

Establish a residence acceptable to his agent.

Credit for 332 days if revoked.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Amended 4-30-18:  Sentence credit is amended to 845 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, or by any other means, unless the victims request and the agent approves.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with extended supervision conditions.

Undergo a mental health evaluation and comply with all recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Amending JOC to reflect 845 days sentence credit
from DOC.  Sent to Judge Becker 4/18/18.  JMM
Transcript of Sentencing hearing on revocation held on 2-1-2018

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Prior.  Parties have the revocation packet.  No corrections or changes noted.  Victim notification complied with. State recommended:  5-7 years total.  2-3 years initial confinement with extended supervision.  Credit per defense.  Extended supervision conditions:  no contact with victims unless they request and the agent approves.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions. AODA and recommended treatment.  Mental health treatment.   Defense recommended:  Chapter 51. Court:  County needs to made a referral or a three party petition need to be filed.  Corporation counsel and County have not pursued.  Defense stated alternate grounds for commitment.  Has also looked into voluntary commitment.  Defendant has been revoked. 2 years prison with extended supervision.  Recommends Wisconsin Resource Center placement.  Agent Miles is present.  No community based placements available through probation. Defendant exercised his right to allocution.

Court discussed defendant's status.  Options are fine, costs or jail/prison.  Public safety at issue. Court ordered:  7  years total.  Bifurcated as 3 1/2  years initial confinement and 3 1/2 years extended supervision.    Extended supervision conditions:  No contact with victims unless they request, and the agent approves.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions. AODA and recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Comply with mental health assessment and comply with all recommendations.  Judgment for unpaid court costs.   Credit for 584 days.  Eligible for SAP and CIP.
SEHR rescheduled at request of Atty Prior; ok'd with DA's office.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 1, 2018 at 11:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 2, 2018 at 09:00 am.
From DOC along with revocation packet

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Prior.  Defendant plead no contest to count 1 of the information.  Victim notification complied with.  Count 2, dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes. Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the count he plead to.  Defendant understood.  Felony warnings given.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of arson of building without consent, contrary to 943.02(1)(a).  Joint recommendation for 5 years probation.  Continue with mental health aftercare plan.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion. No contact with R. Eddy, or A. Reichenbach.  Only live where his agent approves.  CC. DNA sample and surcharge.  332 days credit.  

Court ordered: sentence withheld, 5 years probation.  Follow up consistently with mental health aftercare plan.   Agent to ensure he has the medications he needs.  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion. Subject to random drug screens by his agent.  No contact with R. Eddy, or A. Reichenbach.  Establish a residence that his agent approves.  CC. DNA sample and surcharge.  If revoked, credit for 332 days.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: DE competent to stand trial, suspension lifted

records.addlTxt: Court questioned the defendant on his understanding of the waiver of preliminary hearing.  He stated that he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly, freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to a preliminary hearing.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Prior.  State and defense stipulate that the defendant is competent to proceed.  Defendant agrees.  Court orders the defendant continue to take medications as prescribed and comply with therapy and recommendations of the treatment providers.  Find that the defendant is compentent to proceed.   Attorney prior states that the defendant has 205 days credit on 15CM169.  State stipulates to that figure.  No response received from the victim in 15CM169.  State moved to dismiss 15CM169.  Court dismissed 15CM169.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Competency hearing at 01-08-2016 01:30 pm

Defendant appeared in custody from Jackson County Jail.  His attorney Matthew Prior also present.  Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Report was received by both counsel.  Attorney Prior has reviewed that report with his client.  DA Fox states that he accepts the findings of Dr. Heinz which show the defendant is not competent but may become competent with treatment.  Judge questions defendant to determine competency.  Court finds defendant is not competent; incapable of accepting advantages to treatment; orders commitment for treatment and remanded to Wisconsin DHS.  Evaluations to be done at 3, 6, and 9 months and w/in 30 days of expiration.  Prior requests a hearing after 1st evaluation.  Counsel are to schedule hearing to re-evaluate competency with J.A. and to have a notation on the notice if defendant is to appear.
for Competency Examination by DHS.
Competency hearing at 10-16-2015 01:30 pm

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail. Attorney Prior appeared in person.  Waive reading of complaints.  Request for competency examination by Attorney Prior.  Probable cause found by the court from the complaint.  Examination ordered.  Comp hearing to be set in approx. 60 days.  Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance at 08-10-2015 09:30 am

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail.  Defendant has not contacted SPD yet.  Court asked defendant if he wants attorney.  He said yes.  Call SPD. Options explained to defendant.  AIA set for 8/10/15 at 9:30 am.  Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance at 08-03-2015 09:30 am

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant in custody in the jail.  Defendant not cooperative with jail staff.  Will not appear for bond hearing today.  Court found probable cause to detain the defendant.  State requests $5,000 cash bond.  If defendant desires a bond hearing, it can be set for Friday.
